ul.li: rapidly prototyping language, compiler, and runtime features
freely experimenting with parsers and syntax
build new languages in an extensible and modular fashion

ul.li: the specific implementation of the Core Language Service along with its executable format(s) and supported platforms
the public API for the compiler server
the protocol used to interact with the compiler server

div.font: Defines a syntax that is parsed as determined by the language into a syntax tree.

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 88px; white-space: nowrap; word-wrap: normal; text-align: center;

display: inline-block; font-size: 13px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; overflow: hidden; max-height: 36px; max-width: 61px; width: 59px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal; font-weight: bold;

display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 10px; white-space: nowrap; word-wrap: normal; font-weight: bold; text-align: center;

display: inline-block; font-size: 16px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; overflow: hidden; max-height: 156px; max-width: 276px; width: 276px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal; text-align: center;
text-align: left

div.div: Each part of the AST is translated down to the Core Language either:

div.style: text-align: left

div.div: (a) directly by the syntax library itself

div.style: text-align: left
text-align: left
text-align: left
text-align: left

div.span: which allows expressing higher-level concepts that are translated down to the

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 16px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap;

display: inline-block; font-size: 16px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; overflow: hidden; max-height: 59px; max-width: 241px; width: 241px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.font: A syntax library can reference any number of semantic libraries.

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 13px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; overflow: hidden; max-height: 36px; max-width: 61px; width: 59px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal; font-weight: bold;

display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 10px; white-space: nowrap; word-wrap: normal; font-weight: bold; text-align: center;

display: inline-block; font-size: 16px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; overflow: hidden; max-height: 156px; max-width: 276px; width: 276px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal; text-align: center;
text-align: left
div.span: can reference any number of other

div.style: text-align: left
text-align: left

div.div: (As shown to the left, Library C

div.style: text-align: left

div.div: re-translates its abstract grammar to be interpreted by Library D)

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 18px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; overflow: hidden; max-height: 36px; max-width: 266px; width: 201px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal; font-weight: bold;

display: inline-block; font-size: 16px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; overflow: hidden; max-height: 167px; max-width: 268px; width: 268px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div: The final step in the compilation pipeline is the Core Language Service.
At this point, the original source code is now entirely expressed in terms of the abstract grammar of the Core Language.

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 16px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; overflow: hidden; max-height: 156px; max-width: 276px; width: 276px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal; text-align: center;
text-align: left

div.div: The Core Language is compiled down to an executable format.

div.style: text-align: left

div.div: (This is up for discussion and is outside the scope of this proposal)

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 20px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; overflow: hidden; max-height: 317px; max-width: 526px; width: 526px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.font: Instead of traditionally tying language, runtime, and compilation features to syntax, each feature is modularized into a semantic language library.

div.span: can be extended and composed to provide higher-level features such as generics, parallelism, reflection, and more.
These features are exposed as an API through an abstract grammar which is translated into the Core Language.

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 34px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; overflow: hidden; max-height: 96px; max-width: 508px; width: 508px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

font.b: A Core Language with Extensible Language Libraries

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 24px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap;
text-align: right
display: inline-block; font-size: 26px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap; font-weight: bold;

display: inline-block; font-size: 20px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; overflow: hidden; max-height: 193px; max-width: 506px; width: 506px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.span: The is achieved either by directly translating parts of the syntax to the
or by re-expressing them into an
can pick and choose which method is appropriate for different parts of the syntax.

div.font: This is essentially the "frontend" of the compilation pipeline.

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 20px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; overflow: hidden; max-height: 98px; max-width: 511px; width: 511px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.font: The final step in the compilation pipeline is the "backend" with the Core Language Service. This exposes the Core Language through an abstract grammar which is compiled to an executable format.

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 20px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; overflow: hidden; max-height: 76px; max-width: 529px; width: 529px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal; font-style: italic;

div.font: This proposal outlines a high-level overview of an architecture for an extensible language development platform for Proton. Feedback is welcome.

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 26px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap; font-weight: bold;

display: inline-block; font-size: 20px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; overflow: hidden; max-height: 75px; max-width: 939px; width: 939px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.font: The annotated diagram below depicts the high-level architecture of what the compilation pipeline would look like for a language implemented using the platform. The project's language, Proton, along with any language prototypes could be implemented using this platform.

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 26px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap; font-weight: bold;

display: inline-block; font-size: 20px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; overflow: hidden; max-height: 36px; max-width: 941px; width: 485px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.font: The platform outlined by this proposal should allow for:

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 26px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap; font-weight: bold;

display: inline-block; font-size: 20px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; overflow: hidden; max-height: 25px; max-width: 941px; width: 531px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.font: The following areas are outside the scope of this proposal:

switch.text: The following areas are outside the scope of this proposal:

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 17px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap; text-align: right;
text-align: right

display: inline-block; font-size: 17px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; overflow: hidden; max-height: 26px; max-width: 224px; width: 159px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal; text-align: center;

display: inline-block; font-size: 20px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; overflow: hidden; max-height: 156px; max-width: 525px; width: 525px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.font: A language's syntax is separately implemented in a syntax language library that has the flexibility of designing any flavor of syntax as long the library can parse it.

font.span: sole requirement is to be able to translate source code

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 20px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; overflow: hidden; max-height: 266px; max-width: 511px; width: 511px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.font: The entirety of the compilation process is housed in a compilation server which "glues" each part of the pipeline together resolving dependencies between language libraries and the Core Language Service.

The compilation server exposes a public API over a protocol for language tooling to interact with. This enables tooling to have an understanding of a language to allow for features such as "smarter" error messages, code completion, code refactorings, find references, syntax highlighting, etc.

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 18px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 75px; white-space: nowrap; word-wrap: normal; font-weight: bold; text-align: center;

display: inline-block; font-size: 16px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; overflow: hidden; max-height: 76px; max-width: 234px; width: 234px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
div.div: Various forms of language tooling function as clients that interact with the compilation server over a protocol.

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 59px; white-space: nowrap; word-wrap: normal; font-weight: bold; text-align: center;

display: inline-block; font-size: 18px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; overflow: hidden; max-height: 54px; max-width: 216px; width: 166px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal; font-weight: bold;

display: inline-block; font-size: 16px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; overflow: hidden; max-height: 76px; max-width: 227px; width: 227px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
div.div: Exposes the compilation pipeline through a public API for clients to interact with.

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 167px; white-space: nowrap; word-wrap: normal; text-align: center;

display: inline-block; font-size: 16px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; overflow: hidden; max-height: 54px; max-width: 487px; width: 480px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

font.span: This work is licensed under a

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 16px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; overflow: hidden; max-height: 197px; max-width: 236px; width: 236px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal; text-align: center;
text-align: left

div.div: The syntax tree built by the parser has all the information necessary to rebuilt the original source text. This allows for directly editing the syntax tree to effectively make changes to the source text.

div.style: text-align: left

div.div: (See also the Roslyn Project's Overview on this topic)
